Articles.Content:
This mod is made for the one who love making twin engine fighter but who don't like the Mk2 bicoupler.

It will add a set of part witch look like two Mk1 fuselage stick together with the texture of the Mk2 set

![mod_mk2_5_fuselage_presentation_by_benjigh-d8l3evr.png](http://img15.deviantart.net/f6b5/i/2015/068/2/0/mod_mk2_5_fuselage_presentation_by_benjigh-d8l3evr.png)

![mk2_5_fuselage_expesion_mod_released_by_benjigh-d8n3kmr.png](http://img15.deviantart.net/42ce/i/2015/084/d/b/mk2_5_fuselage_expesion_mod_released_by_benjigh-d8n3kmr.png)

Here are the three first parts I've modeled (from left to right: Mk2.5 air intake fuselage (still have to import in unity),Mk2.5 fuselage (lf) and Mk2.5-Mk2 adaptor)

There are only three parts for now but I'm open to suggestions

Planned parts:

Mk2.5-Mk1 adapter

Mk2.75 fuselage,fuselage+air intake,adapters for Mk1,Mk2 and Mk2.5 (more F-15 style fuselage but with stock textures)

Maybe a cockpit who know?

And some ideas picked up on this thread of course :-)

**Download link**: [https://www.dropbox.com/sh/p003lnsv78leafu/AACr4EWUe1kkS5tBcLIh5vDta?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/sh/p003lnsv78leafu/AACr4EWUe1kkS5tBcLIh5vDta?dl=0)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-26T23:10:18Z" title="03/26/2015 11:10  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 26, 2015</time> by BenjiGH**
  
Release of version 0.1
Cool!
Thanks
Nice!

Good. 

More suggestions - mk2.5 to mk1 adapter with air intakes. Twin engine like on B-52, and same intake.

![16179486-close-up-view-of-the-rear-of-the-american-b-52-stratofortress-long-range-bomber-jet-engines.jpg](http://us.123rf.com/450wm/fotoluminate/fotoluminate1211/fotoluminate121100100/16179486-close-up-view-of-the-rear-of-the-american-b-52-stratofortress-long-range-bomber-jet-engines.jpg)![b52-bomber-jet-engines-19951034.jpg](http://thumbs.dreamstime.com/x/b52-bomber-jet-engines-19951034.jpg)

> 
> Good. 
> More suggestions - mk2.5 to mk1 adapter with air intakes. Twin engine like on B-52, and same intake.
> 
> [http://us.123rf.com/450wm/fotoluminate/fotoluminate1211/fotoluminate121100100/16179486-close-up-view-of-the-rear-of-the-american-b-52-stratofortress-long-range-bomber-jet-engines.jpg](http://us.123rf.com/450wm/fotoluminate/fotoluminate1211/fotoluminate121100100/16179486-close-up-view-of-the-rear-of-the-american-b-52-stratofortress-long-range-bomber-jet-engines.jpg) [http://thumbs.dreamstime.com/x/b52-bomber-jet-engines-19951034.jpg](http://thumbs.dreamstime.com/x/b52-bomber-jet-engines-19951034.jpg)

The adapter from mk1 to mk2.5 is planned already (with and without air intakes) as well as a short adapter for two mk1

And the b-52 style twin engine is a really good idea

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-11T15:04:06Z" title="03/11/2015 03:04  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 11, 2015</time> by BenjiGH**

Uh, in case you good folks are unaware, B9 has a B-52 style twin engine pod that looks almost identical to that second picture. FYI. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) But of course if you want to make another one that interfaces with these parts, I'm pretty sure no one will complain. Some folks don't like B9 specifically because it has TOO MANY parts (in their opinion), so such a thing in this (currently) much smaller parts pack may hold more appeal. 

Anyway, I just thought I'd throw that out there, FWIW. Later! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Neutrinovore:

In B9 there are just one jet engine like this but it's true that when you stick two together it look like the one on the photo (at least the last time I used it) and it's true that there are way too many parts in B9, in my opinion they should have divided it in packs

> 
> Neutrinovore:
> In B9 there are just one jet engine like this but it's true that when you stick two together it look like the one on the photo (at least the last time I used it) and it's true that there are way too many parts in B9, in my opinion they should have divided it in packs

Wait a minute, I was in error before. B9 doesn't have that twin engine pod, you're right. I believe it's in LackLustreLab's SXT pack. Sorry for giving incorrect info. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
No problem (look in the mkV mod, you'll find those nacelles)
Looks nice! Are you using the stock mk2 textures or just matching the style?
Those are the stock one imported with the mu importer add on for blender

ok.....

I want that!![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif) Great work i really can't wait to see those

And if you could make an engine like the X33 with it? that would be awesome XD

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-13T16:26:05Z" title="03/13/2015 04:26  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 13, 2015</time> by S1000RRHP4**

> 
> And if you could make an engine like the X33 with it? that would be awesome XD

If you're referring to a linear aerospike, one exists for the Mk2 hull system - it's in Lack's SXT (Stock eXTension) mod. There's a bigger one in OPT Space Plane Parts by K.Yeon.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-13T22:08:33Z" title="03/13/2015 10:08  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 13, 2015</time> by Autochton**

> 
> If you're referring to a linear aerospike, one exists for the Mk2 hull system - it's in Lac's SXT (Stock eXTension) mod. There's a bigger one in OPT Space Plane Parts by K.Yeon.

Yes i know i alreadu have them, but MOAR is better

For the moment I have big issues with the mu export (blender) it don't want to export the texture and when I try with unity it don't import them so the release will take longer than expected :-( but I plan to make a whole set for (space)planes (air intakes,engines,fuselage,cockpit,...)

- - - Updated - - -

Also thanks to sumghai for fixing the image :-)

> 
> Yes i know i alreadu have them, but MOAR is better

I admit, there's a point. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> I admit, there's a point. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

This is why I am making this mod :-)

Little problem with cfg ...

[http://benjigh.deviantart.com/art/Problems-with-node-cfg-522519598?ga_submit_new=10%253A1427312519](http://benjigh.deviantart.com/art/Problems-with-node-cfg-522519598?ga_submit_new=10%253A1427312519)

Looks like it could be a model offset issue. 

In blender, check to make sure that the that the centre of the model you are exporting is set to the actual centre, and not say offset to the origin of the scene.

I've solved the problem before the release, it was in Unity, my gameobject was not in the center nor the model so when I set the node to be on 0.0 , +-1.5 , 0.0 It was taking the scene in Unity in reference
How do i get these parts in my game???
You drop the file you've downloaded in the gamedata file ( I might organise the files a bit better thought )
How come I haven't noticed this before? You texturing work is really good!
Very nice, will the middle middle have 3 stack nodes on each side? Because on the screendump I see you have connected 2 engines to it.
